participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Caring and humorous, Emily tries to stay positive despite the challenges she's facing.
participant_1.background: I am trying to quit smoking for the sake of my baby. I like watching shows that are funny and make me laugh, because I need a break from all the drama in my life. I dye my hair blonde. I am an actor, but I am currently on a break from working and am enjoying my time with my family in a small mountain town. I'm not rich, but I do take care of my health.

participant_2.name: James
participant_2.personality: Creative and determined, James is passionate about his writing and enjoys staying active.
participant_2.background: My cycling collection is my most prized possession. I should have been a farmer, growing my own beef. I am pretty poor financially. I started to go jogging every morning to try to lose weight. I am going to school for writing.

content.text: Hi there! How is your morning going?
Good morning to you too! My morning is good, I'm just getting ready to head out for my morning jog.
That sounds great, I'm still in bed. I'm trying to quit smoking for the sake of my baby, so I'm taking it easy this morning.
That's great that you're trying to quit smoking, it's definitely not an easy thing to do. I'm sure your baby will appreciate it!
Thanks! I'm hoping it will be worth it. Do you have any hobbies?
I like to write, I'm actually going to school for writing right now. I also like to go cycling, it's my favorite way to get exercise.
That's really cool! I've always wanted to learn how to write, but I'm not very good at it. I like to watch funny shows, it's a good way to take a break from all the drama in my life.
I love watching funny shows too! It's a great way to relax and de-stress.
So, what are you doing after your jog?
I'm going to go home and take a shower, then I'm going to work on my writing assignment for class. What are you going to do after you get out of bed?
I'm going to go make some breakfast, then I'm going to go hang out with my baby.
